I just returned from a trip to Hawaii. A good friend of mine gave to me as aparting gift a copy of the new testament written in Hawaiian pidgeon. It would be comical if the authors hadn't been so serious about its purpose. It is equivalent to the new testament in ebonics.I cannot read it without cracking up. 
 
 Do those of you that take religon seriously find this affencive? Just wondering.

Not really, but I'm only 15. To be religious, you don't realy have to read the bible. It helps you be more religious but some people have problems understanding the Bible. It could be funny to some people but as long as you are religious it doesn't matter.

No, as a Christian, I do not. If it's funny, then it's funny, and God has a great sense of humor. Some people need to just lighten up and not take things so seriously all the time, especially when it comes to God. He wants us to enjoy Him, not freak out over something so trite.

 This is true...
 When I was a boy we went to see a commune of people living on a creek bank down the road. Our Sunday school teacher was curious about the signs they had posted: "Come and Meet the Lord!"
 We saw them sitting around a fire and passing around a little of the “spirit”…my first smell of marijuana.
 
 Of course we didn’t get to stay… emoticon_xdonno emoticon_xangel
